_header: Men them bemoanen of little truth / It is dead and that is ruth
_description: On the degeneracy of the times — two couplets translating ‘Heu plebs conqueritur’, etc.

OxfMert248.Transcription:
hallas men planys of litel trwthehit ys dede and tat is
                    rwthefalsedum regnis and es a boweand vyris es trwloue
OxfMert248.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 54.
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Preachers, Poets and the English Lyric.
         Princeton: Princeton Univ. Press, 1986: 191.

BLHar2316.Transcription: Men hem bemenin of litel trewtheit is ded and ȝat is rewtheLesing liuet and is aboueAnd now is biried trewthe and loue
BLHar2316.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 2.121.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 259.

OxfBal227.Transcription:
Men hem pleynit of mikil vntrewtheRyt is det & ȝat is
                    rewtheTrecherye leuit & is aboueSouthe is buryit trewe
                    loue
OxfBal227.Note:
Written as verse; both it and the Latin it translates (Heu plebs
                        conqueritur…) added to lower margin of page by a hand of the
                    fourteenth century.
OxfBal227.Editions:
Mynors,  Roger Aubrey Baskerville,
                        ed.  
             Catalogue of Manuscripts in Balliol College Library.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1962: 229.

BLEge2788.Transcription:
Right is deed and þat is rewþeAnd haþ be beried pees
                    & trew&effalsne & pride regnen a boueAnd haue be beried
                    trewe loue
